title: Poly Tant 820-2850
message:
It seems as though the 2850 is notorious for C9560 issues as its a Poly Tant Cap. I was wondering, I have a number of donor boards (different numbers), but all the 330UF caps seem to be Poly Tant.  Are there boards with better versions or should I just buy a CERM 330uf from digikey or something?  Also does it matter if its a 2.5v cap? just as long as its 330UF?

PS. Symptoms are that it intermittently shuts down and gets really hot really fast around the CPU.  Shutdown/reset seems to happen frequently after "waking", but also during use of Safari. Its fully functional otherwise, and has no signs of drop or liquid. Figured I would do a plz bro repair with the cap since they are so common with these.

title: Poly Tant 820-2850
message: You need to match the voltage rating on the original caps... A ceramic would work IF you could get it to fit.

title: Poly Tant 820-2850
message: I can see that being an issue if its under, but it would only be .5 over the orig. What are people using as direct replacements then?

title: Poly Tant 820-2850
message: Just use the standard size 330uF and not the small ones.

title: Poly Tant 820-2850
message: As long as its over the voltage rating and not under its fine

title: Poly Tant 820-2850
message: As in replace with another polytant?

title: Poly Tant 820-2850
message: What about the rest of my question?

title: Poly Tant 820-2850
message: Poly tant isnt the issue. It is the small form factor and bad batch of caps that is.
